Reviews.Title: If you're looking for something basic, this is the way to go.
Reviews.Author: Gina Love "G.L.Fire"
Reviews.Content: I wouldn't call it the most sophisticated tech I ever bought, but after downloading Microsoft Office Home and Student (purchased separately), it's an affordable option that meets my needs. I think that's the key to any technology purchase--know your needs. Mine are emailing, writing, research, surfing, shopping, socializing, and other pretty low-level uses. If these are your needs as well, this is the machine for you.

Reviews.Title: Just the right size for a netbook
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "mkmagu"
Reviews.Content: I purchase this after getting a used acer 10.1" netbook and found the keyboard to small to do any real typing on it. This netbook has a fantastic 11.6" display that gives sharp video playback. The keyboard is good size and allows for easy typing. The weight and size make it very easy to carry around. On the negative side I wish the battery held a better charge and the touchpad can be a little over sensitive. I ended up getting a wireless mouse which solve my problem with the touchpad which I think is more me than the netbook. I have my netbook set up to dual boot into Windows 8 & Linux Mint 13. Overall I'm very happy with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: Good for writers and person on the go
Reviews.Author: Tate O'Brien "Tate Obrien"
Reviews.Content: This compact computer is efficient for simple needs such as surfing, letters, blogging and a few hidden games/solitaire.  I love the color (Red) and how lightweight it is. I loaded StarOffice (thanks amazon) as not to purchase another expensive license. Star office is compatible with all office programs and it works similar to office XP (good enough for me).  I digress, battery life is efficient for me and my needs.  I purchased my system through Wal-Mart during a sale for $198.00 which is what I think this system is worth.  Not good for high powered games or extensive wear and tear.  Further, I hate Windows 8 - who tested that thing.  Its awful and after experiencing it on this computer, I'm definitely not upgrading even if they gave it to me for free. In addition, I agree with the mouse pad being sensitive and did exactly what another rater did, purchased a mouse and disabled it.  It's a little slow to start and shut down - hopefully, upgrading memory will help that.All in all, I like my system.  I took a star for Windows 8 - hated it...

Reviews.Title: Acer Aspire One AO756-2641 review
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I like this laptop. The new windows 8 is really difficult to navigate but acer gives you the option of the acer desktop which is what non-windows 8 users are used to. it is light, quick and compact and is perfect for blogging and drafting documents. A good buy and worth the money.

Reviews.Title: Acer Aspire AO756-2641
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This model was chosen for its combination of performance and price. It's great for home and small business use where portability is desired. Functions best with at least 4GB of memory (has 2GB stock). It's not good for high demand gaming as there isn't enough "horsepower". Battery life is about 4 hours, depending upon internet use. Complaints have been made about the wireless card dropping the signal frequently. My unit has the Broadcom wireless adapter. The driver provided is poor. Merely go to the Device Manager in Windows, select the Broadcom wireless 802.11n and replace the driver with the one provided by Microsoft (5.100.245.20). In addition, in the Power Options go to the Advanced portion and set the wireless adapter to "Maximum" on both battery and plugged in. This change avoids internet drops if the wireless is unused for several minutes. Very pleased so far - let's see what the future holds.UPDATE Aug 2013. This unit functions well for business use using programs such as Word, Excel, Powerpoint, etc. It slows a bit if several programs are open at once. If that's a task parameter you need, get the I5 processor version which my wife uses. Internet function is fine with very good range and no drops. As noted previously, it's not good for demanding games. Nice and light for traveling. I'd buy it again for sure.

Reviews.Title: Great netbook!
Reviews.Author: Kathryn J. King "KaKing"
Reviews.Content: I am giving this little guy 5 stars because it has been performing for me in every way I need it to. I was in search of an inexpensive, small laptop to do some light web surfing/research and word processing. In the week that I've had it, I am very pleased!The first thing I did after booting up the netbook (to make sure everything loaded up okay), was install more RAM ordered from the Crucial website, because they guarantee the correct size for your machine. This netbook only comes with 2 GB of RAM, which I was afraid wouldn't quite be enough to handle my multi-tasking. There is one 2 GB stick in one slot, and there is another slot that is empty. I upgraded to the max amount of 8 GB with two 4 GB sticks. The bottom plate was relatively easy to remove and the slots are there in the center, plain as day. I believe this will allow the netbook to run at its best.The processor is weak, so boot up, shut down, and opening programs is going to take slightly longer than you're used to if you've been working on a newer desktop with a big, shiny processor. I don't need a super fast processor to play Diablo on this thing, so I can wait an extra second for load time. It doesn't bother me, because I expected it.I am very pleased with the size of the screen and the keyboard - it feels almost like 100% of a regular keyboard. (I think maybe it's 92%? Not sure.) Sound quality and video playback from YouTube videos have been satisfactory. Not mind blowing, but no glitches either. Some reviewers have commented on the poor sound quality, but I don't have an issue with it.On the negative, there are 3 issues:1. The top of the machine has a shiny, glossy surface which is pretty, but attracts my grubby fingerprints like the dickens. But that's merely aesthetic, and the box comes with a cleaning cloth.2. I have been having recurring issues connecting to Wi-Fi networks. I usually need to run the troubleshooting app to fix it, and then all is well. This, of course, may be due to my own lack of knowledge regarding IP's and network configurations, etc.3. Personally, I have found that the battery will last me only about 3.5 hours on average. This is a bit shorter than I'd like, but still functional.Overall, I think this netbook is a perfect fit for anyone with needs similar to mine - word processing, web surfing, and an inexpensive machine that travels well. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: A little slow buit fine for older users
Reviews.Author: Up in the Air
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my mother who had a problem with the heavier laptops.  Without an optical drive it was the perfect weight to check emails, etc.  I had to use an external drive I already had to load Office and Norton.  Amazon has a good (and cheap) universal drive if you dont have one.  Windows 8 is a little difficult to work with by using the pad only.  Order a wireless mouse and case with it like I did.  Windows 8 was new to me but I tutored myself after setup.  Had to do a complete restore one time when McAfee failed to completely delete.  Remember to restart after deleting to completely remove before loading new software.  I had an older model of this as a backup for myself and knew it to be reliable.  The processer is adequate and the webcam worked much better than I expected.  You will need headphones for sound.  The speakers at full volume can be heard but are underneath and easily obstructed and sound will never be loud enough for music or skyping.  does not have a mike input

Reviews.Title: Almost..........Just Almost!!!
Reviews.Author: Kester
Reviews.Content: This Notebook is really powerful for its size, Its great for everyday use and for light gaming, which makes its defect even more crushing.....for some reason the notebook does not detect the charger, the only way to circumvent this problem is to remove the battery and start it straight from the charger, then reinsert the battery at which point the note book will begin to charge the battery.What a frustrating defect!... so I checked forums and the Acer site a few people had this problem, a suggested solution was to update the bios which I did however the only relief I got from the update was as long as the battery is 85-100% charged the charger would register otherwise the charger would not register and I would have to employ my adhoc solution.So to the date of this review I am living with this problem like a chronic ailment.

Reviews.Title: Like it!
Reviews.Author: SEAN
Reviews.Content: It's getting to a point where I use my iPad for everything, but sometimes you just need a "real" computer/keyboard. My desktop died last month so I went out and bought a new of of those and I figured while I was at it, I'd update my laptop as well. Thanks to the Amazon trade in program I traded in 3 of my older/slower laptops I had laying around and was happy to get enough $$$ to buy this. I was looking at a Chromebook but I decided to spend the few extra bucks and get a genuine Windows machine.For those who do not know...This is a netbook. It does not have a CD/DVD drive. It's not supposed to. You can pretty much download anything from the internet or use USB drives/memory cards if you really need to add something. The machine seems to be well built. It is lightweight. Windows 8 seems to boot up pretty quick. Maybe 30 seconds to a minute. The specs for what it is are fine. It's pretty responsive, and quick to open/close programs. I like the fact you can upgrade the RAM. I don't see the need now, but if I find a good deal on RAM I might pull the trigger (More RAM is never a bad thing.)All that being said, if you are looking at this unit, please be advised...it is a netbook. They are inexpensive, low to medium spec computers. If you demand high speed gaming or you make your living as a graphic artist perhaps this is not the machine for you. If you just need something for writing, web browsing, watching netflix, listening to music, social media and whatnot then you'll be happy.

Reviews.Title: Great  PC with a Great Pedigree
Reviews.Author: Steve Nazigian "steve0701"
Reviews.Content: The Acer Aspire One is actually a family of various models of netbook computers available in dozens of different configurations. The size is comparable to an Ipad, but with the addition of a touch pad and a real keyboard. Perhaps its biggest advantage over a tablet is that you get a big hard drive and an operating system powerful enough to run several major applications at once. I bought my Aspire One four years ago and am still extremely pleased with everything about it.  Even so, the specs just keep getting better and better with every new edition. Multi-gesture touchpad, more memory, HDMI output, 320GB hard drive, better display, lower power consumption. I wish all this had been available four years ago! You may be tempted to buy an external optical drive to install additional software, but that may not be necessary. If you have another computer you can probably just copy your installation disks to a memory stick and install from there.

Reviews.Title: An ergonomical nightmare
Reviews.Author: Matthew E. Lockwood "Matt reads"
Reviews.Content: No complaints about the OS, or the screen res...etc.The location of the mousepad vis-a-vis the keys is such that while typing, your thumbs can inadvertently brush the mousepad, and move your cursor to random places on the screen. Its maddening! Especially if you are typing fast. Worst keyboard design I have ever experienced.

Reviews.Title: Acer Aspire One AO756-2641
Reviews.Author: Sue
Reviews.Content: I purchased this computer for my grandaugher for Christmas.  It was reasonably priced and with this being her first computer it was great!  She could do everything on this one as you could a regular computer.  It was well made and worth the price.  I would recommend this computer to everyone!!

Reviews.Title: Not much to me
Reviews.Author: Bob S.
Reviews.Content: Was expecting more of this machine does not suit my needs. Almost useless for internet browsing and is so slow it irritates me

Reviews.Title: Buy another notebook!!!
Reviews.Author: SHOEVIXEN "meg"
Reviews.Content: It's beyond slow and the new Windows 8 takes up all the memory. I would definitely not purchase this computer.

Reviews.Title: Too slow to be usable
Reviews.Author: D. Crouch
Reviews.Content: We have had this for a while. For very basic web surfing it is ok, and I mean only ok. It is horribly slow. I have a windows update running on it right now. That alone is such a painfully slow process, that I felt the need to warn folks about this laptop. Spend the money and make sure you get something with more pep in it. It is borderline useless.

Reviews.Title: Good well priced
Reviews.Author: Alex Beck
Reviews.Content: I bought this laptop for my son. He's very pleased with all the preloaded software and the keyboard layout.Although it took a while to get used to Windows 8.

Reviews.Title: Trash
Reviews.Author: Edwin Bebb
Reviews.Content: This is the slowest, most unresponsive, trash-laden "computer" I have ever owned.  Constantly shuts down wireless card, won't even re-start - you need to hard boot it. Takes ages to start back up.  My first-gen android phone is faster...and more reliable. Windows 8 is terrible too.  Spend the extra couple dollars and get an Asus w/XP.  I've owned both and the Asus was twice the machine.

Reviews.Title: Fast and clean
Reviews.Author: R Allen Smith
Reviews.Content: This is exactly what I was looking for.  Small (not too small), light, fast and Windows 8.  Now I've upgraded to 8.1 and it really doesn't seem to be much change.  The WiDi isn't all it's cracked up to be and it seems that it's mote the Intel technology than the machine so I won't slam anything on that. The lit keyboard is one of the things I was looking for since I was used to Lenovo with a light above the screen that afforded the same ability to work in low light.  I have had a few issues when the touch screen seems to shut down and leave me with curser control only.  I'm not sure that is a machine issue yet but you may want to watch out for that.  All in all, this machine seems to be what I was looking for although it is a bit pricey.

Reviews.Title: GREAT NOTEBOOK FOR THE MONEY.
Reviews.Author: LANLINE
Reviews.Content: AS LONG AS A LAPTOP IS WORKING CORRECTLY AND DOING WHAT IT'S SUPPOSE TO DO WITHOUT ANY DISCREPANCIES IN IT'S LIFE CYCLE I'LL GIVE IT A TOP RATING. HAVE HAD A FEW LAPTOPS BEFORE THIS ONE. I'VE ADDED A FEW THINGS TO THE TASK BAR TO MAKE WINDOWS 8 A LITTLE BIT LIKE 7. HOWEVER I THINK WINDOWS 8 IS SUPERB. YOU JUST HAVE TO LEARN HOW TO GET AROUND IT. THE LAPTOP ITSELF HAS BEEN WORKING GREAT FOR 6 MONTHS NOW AND THAT SAYS ALOT. FOR THE MONEY...I PAID $299.99, IT'S CHEAPER THAN SOME SMART PHONES. CHECK IT OUT.

Reviews.Title: Good deal
Reviews.Author: L. Lopez
Reviews.Content: Overall a good deal for price I paid ($249 at time of purchase) Keys can be sticky when new but this seems to be resolving on its own with regular use. Speedier than I thought it would be, but I don't use it for applications that are too demanding. Some reviewers dislike Win 8. The new Windows 8.1, which you can upgrade to for free through the Windows App Store for free is an improvement, brings the start menu back for those who desire previous Windows versions' feel. The touch pad can be used with Windows 8 functions, you have to take the time to learn how to use it, you can do more than point and click with the touch pad on a Windows 8 machine, it sort of emulates touching the screen, just take some time and learn how to. Also the touch pad sucks, BUT if you upgrade the driver to the most recent ELAN driver, and adjust the settings to your liking then you should be happier with it.

Reviews.Title: satisfying
Reviews.Author: Alex k.
Reviews.Content: This netbook is really good vaule/price deal. It doesnt have top notch speed of course, but it can handle almost anything. Provided with good internet, it can handle some online games (like LoL) enough. but i recommend to test it out before someone decide to purchase. I never had change to try it out, but it was still good deal. Better suited for school work as college student. The bad thing is the short battery like (usually 3-4 hours), but the charger is so compact and it is really easy to charge. I mean it doesnt feel like it is a hassle to plug in since the charger itself is raelly user-friendly. It could be a little bit noisy for extremely quite library-atmosphere. Overall, it is best suited for studying.

Reviews.Title: Not worth the money
Reviews.Author: M. Corinne Corley "The Lady Gardenia"
Reviews.Content: I bought this laptop thinking I would have a viable option to use at work and bring with me on the road. It seemed to have enough processor and memory to use on a daily basis but be small enough to be easily portable. I have a large monitor at the office so planned to use the monitor I have with this laptop.  The price was right.  Big mistake. I should have spent another $100 or $150 for a more useful item. This machine freezes if more than one program is open and takes several minutes even to open Word.  It freezes if you open a PDF attachment.  Not worth the money. Buy even a higher model of the same brand, possibly, but give this one a miss.

Reviews.Title: i like this laptop
Reviews.Author: Guillermo Arrieta
Reviews.Content: it help me very much with everything i needed and windows 8.1 is awsome with acer and laptop is so light to carry around

Reviews.Title: So far my son is satisfied with his new Acer mini-laptop
Reviews.Author: Buffalo Bill "Cody"
Reviews.Content: In the past (about 5 years ago) , my son had repeated problems with his old 15-inch Acer laptop & because 3 or 4 "fixes" provided under the manufacturer's & extended warranties did not resolve those problems to our satisfaction, we were very hesitant to even consider purchasing another Acer. However, in the last few years, Acer's products & service seem to have improved & this mini-laptop was just what he was looking for. So far he's happy with it, but I suppose that only time will tell.

Reviews.Title: Hybrid
Reviews.Author: Heather L. Emry
Reviews.Content: I am not a computer whiz. I liked the price. However I had gotten confused by the labeling of this product. It said laptop. But then later called it a netbook. It actually is a hybrid. It has a large hard drive and yet no cd. I can remedy that by buying a portable dvd/cd player. I hate windows eight. I imagine it would be better with a touch screen. I like the size. Three pounds and easy to pack around.It runs a little slower. But all in all I feel I got my money's worth. The multi gesture pad sucks if you haven't figured it out. Once you get a feel for the comp it is amazingly awesome.

Reviews.Title: Windows 8 is tricky
Reviews.Author: Anirudh Sethi
Reviews.Content: I use it generally for web browsing and simple s/w like MS Office. The computer serves the purpose well. If it were Win 7 I would have loved it. Win 8 is just okay.

Reviews.Title: I guess so-so
Reviews.Author: Monica
Reviews.Content: Whie the computer is a great starter for a child.  I have lots of problems with it.  Battery life, for one is not what was expected, it is way shorter.  Also, the network adapter constantly needs to be reset.  Also, it runs on Windows 8 which is not very user friendly.  Start up is fast.  And the kids are able to do what they need to on it so I will say it's okay.  There is no CD drive either which is another thumbs down.  I admit,maybe I didnt pay enough attention to that when I purchased it.  All in all, for kids, its okay.

Reviews.Title: love the computer... tolerating windows 8...
Reviews.Author: Ron Lawson
Reviews.Content: Still don't care much for the Windows 8 environment...  seems a little cumbersome to me.  But I'm getting used to it...  otherwise,  love the size of the computer...  might be a little small for some but works for me!

Reviews.Title: Great Netbook
Reviews.Author: Young NYer 10
Reviews.Content: This is a great alternative for a full size laptop or i Pad. Don't expect it to perform like a top speed computer, but for the use and need it works wonders. Got it during black Friday at a great price.

Reviews.Title: Small and easy to carry but hard to hear and hard to us mouse pad
Reviews.Author: LEJ.org
Reviews.Content: The mousepad is very difficult to control. The sound is poor quality and hard to hear. Four word fill requirement.

Reviews.Title: I loved it a lot
Reviews.Author: BADAR
Reviews.Content: Very practical, wonderful Notebook, with magnificent Winds 8Lacks a very simple thing, it doesn't have a CD WriterBut managed of external use in cases of necessity.

Reviews.Title: it's a great machine but no have dvd, im a little dissapointed
Reviews.Author: LUIS J CASTILLO Q
Reviews.Content: it's a great machine but no have dvd, im a little dissapointed but have the plus of came it with windows 8, good deal for the price

Reviews.Title: Don't waste the little money this thing costs... Not a good product at all
Reviews.Author: Adward Blinder "compassionate conservative"
Reviews.Content: I guess I should have known this going in, but this thing is really annoying to use... Everything from the mouse pad being small and clumsy, to the slow loading. You pretty much get what you pay for.Only giving 2 stars because I really should have known some of this going in...

Reviews.Title: Bad TouchPad
Reviews.Author: Zyde "zyde"
Reviews.Content: Everything works great on this computer, except the touchpad mouse.  It presents so many different errors while using it...not errors like driver errors, but errors like not recognizing touch or, especially, over-recognizing our touch and clicks.  At first I thought it was just me, as I've always used a USB mouse for my office laptop...so my touchpad experience was limited...but everyone who comes over (it's my house's community laptop) has the exact same issues and curses it to damnation :)

Reviews.Title: Acer Aspire -aspires to greater things than it can be
Reviews.Author: D. Estrin
Reviews.Content: I purchased this item for a Masters Degree program which I will be starting next month. The computer is slow to turn on, slow to play, and is not very intuitive. I have owned Acer computers in the past and have never been unhappy with them before, but this computer is not showing itself to be the greatest thing since sliced bread yet. Hopefully it will be up for the task when school starts next month, otherwise I will have to send it back and get a larger, clunkier computer to record my Masters experience.

Reviews.Title: Great Note book
Reviews.Author: Daniel LaDuke
Reviews.Content: It was fun playing with it. It came with windows 8, I think I like windows 7 much better.It is clear, fast and tons of apps. I was impressed with the quality sound (with my Bose earphones).It quickly navigated to my home network  and transferred files from my desktop.Hard to believe something so small has such a large storage capacity. The only thing I wish it had was a disk drive.Dan LaDuke

Reviews.Title: nice computer
Reviews.Author: Barbara Turner
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my grand daughter  she is taking classes on line for her batchelors degree in nursing  has really helped as she can do homework at any time since she has two teenagers who use the desktop so she had to do her things between theirs.

Reviews.Title: Nearly what I expected
Reviews.Author: Merne A.
Reviews.Content: I've had a few issues with the OS already.  Probably not a hardware problem, but hard to tell.  Kinda meh.  Probably should've kept the money.

Reviews.Title: Great Little Computer
Reviews.Author: phyharris
Reviews.Content: This Acer does not disappoint. For the price you get a powerhouse packed in a small package.  It's lightweight, easy to carry, I pack it in my purse. It is no bigger than a tablet. It is fast and gets great battery time--I get 4.5 hours on one charge. Windows 8 took some getting use to but once you do it is so much better as an OS. This Acer is not touch screen but the mousepad is so responsive to a light touch you almost forget the screen isn't touch capable.  I like the 3 USB outlets, the HDMI outlet, my SD card went in easily, the camera is great, and the speakers are loud. For the low cost you get pricier options and a great little computer. I'm very happy with this purchase!

Reviews.Title: It crashed after using only twice
Reviews.Author: Danryan4
Reviews.Content: I had to send for the laptop to be repaired after using on twice.  The battery heats up after 45 minutes and this is the worst product I have every brought. TOTALLY DISAPOINTED!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: not at all working
Reviews.Author: shenlingfeng
Reviews.Content: if you want to buy this item, this is what you should know: the internet goes horribly slowly like 90 years old men. It takes you couple of minutes to open a website, not to mention if you want something download.

Reviews.Title: Don't really like Windows 8
Reviews.Author: San-Fan Hung
Reviews.Content: I still think Windows 7 is better; Windows 8 has installed too many craps for you before you start using it, which I just found annoying since I had to uninstall a lot of stuff that I don't need at all.

Reviews.Title: Great basic laptop
Reviews.Author: Aveesh Kumar
Reviews.Content: Edit - after 1 monthWin8 64 bit makes the laptop worthlessI can safely estimate that win7 32 bit is at least twice (perhaps a bit more) zippy than win8 64 bit - for the 2 GB RAM in the machine. WinXP would have been awesome but the drivers were only for win7...I can boldly state than Win8 preloaded makes this laptop daft...Good luckI lovethe form factor/usability/performance of this laptop. I wasnt sure how it would be after my Dell i3, 8 GB laptop but this isnt bad at all....Caveat - Win8 was practically unusable - so I inserted my Win7 32 bit CD, wiped out everything, instaled win7 and after 3 hours of drivers from acer website - it was brand new (again :-). Acer website made registration easy as well as the process of getting hardware info easy - andregistration includeda $10 Skyoecredit voucher ((perhaps a christmas gift - didnt see it advertised anywhere)Love it

Reviews.Title: WINDOWS 8 Horrible
Reviews.Author: Jack
Reviews.Content: this system is so completely user unfriendly that I am ready to return the laptop. If I can't use it why keep it? I can find no help that doesn't require a degree in computer science. I HATE WINDOWS 8 AND RECOMMEND YOU DO NOT BUY ANYTHING WITH IT.

Reviews.Title: wee i love it
Reviews.Author: Marita Lynn Strauss
Reviews.Content: it is awlsome with all the neat cool apps. plus i can customize anyway i like with all the designs so when i log in. plus it has a lttle arcade that is so addicting. web everything i love

Reviews.Title: ok for computer user
Reviews.Author: nabil h mossad
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for something basic, this is the way to go.The new windows 8 is really difficult to navigate

Reviews.Title: I regret buying it
Reviews.Author: Zardshark
Reviews.Content: I wish I could have rated this zero stars but on Amazon you can only rate 1.The trackpad sucks so badly that I never use it and always carry an external mouse.The screen sucks too because it's reflective so unless you have perfect lighting it's hard to see.There is this stupid program it runs called read HD audio or some shit that takes up CPU and if you stop it the headphone jack won't work.  So either you have a slow computer or no headphones.  On, yeah it's already very slow anyways.The worst part is the pathetic battery life.  I always leave this piece of shit plugged in.  I also have the screen set to dim and the battery life still sucks.  like 2 hours or something pathetic.So, in conclusion, the screen is bad, the mouse is bad, the battery is bad, and it's slow.  Worst laptop you can get.I regret buying this piece of shit and will never get an Acer again.

Reviews.Title: DO NOT BUY
Reviews.Author: Matt C
Reviews.Content: This computer with the loaded software is total GARBAGE.....DO NOT BUY....I have spent more time with Tech support "in India" than I have on the computer...locks up...issues with internet connection...etc...the techs are very nice but the problem remains.  I don't know if it's the windows 8, memory, or a combination however if the memory is not large enough for the ops system then do not include w8 as the software.......

Reviews.Title: Acer Aspire One AO756-2641 11.6-Inch Laptop Review
Reviews.Author: Michael Wise
Reviews.Content: Great little laptop.  Certainly not gamer material, or graphics intensive.  It runs a bit choppy with C&C; Generals when there is a lot going on, but otherwise runs terrifically.  I loaded Ubuntu 12.11 on it and that runs flawlessly as well.  The HDMI port needs no extra attention, but definitely upgrade the RAM to 4GB.

Reviews.Title: NOT happy with this
Reviews.Author: rhonda reber
Reviews.Content: I got this laptop after my old one died. I figured it would be easy to use like my older one.. boy was I wrong, the pages jump all over the place. they go from large to small as they please. I have trouble keeping the main sign in page up and am having a tough time learning how to use it. My old instant messenger wont run the webcam on it. Skype is ok but prefer my old IM. I can't lower the IM while I look other stuff on the web. guess ill get used to it. I never used windows 8 before. wish I had known how difficult it is to use

ProductInfo.Features:
Intel Celeron Processor 847 (1.1GHz, 2MB L3 Cache)
2 GB SDRAM
320 GB 5400 rpm Hard Drive
11.6-Inch Screen, Intel HD Graphics
Windows 8, 4-hour battery life
ProductInfo.Name: Acer Aspire One AO756-2641 11.6-Inch Laptop (Ash Black)
